abstract: Henry R. Kravis, the dealmaker who symbolized the merger mania of the 1980s and became one of the most powerful figures on Wall Street, is finally going public on the NYSE, The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz and Julie Creswell report.
snippet: Henry R. Kravis, the dealmaker who symbolized the merger mania of the 1980s and became one of the most powerful figures on Wall Street, is finally going public on the NYSE, The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz and Julie Creswell report.
lead_paragraph: Henry R. Kravis, the dealmaker who symbolized the merger mania of the 1980s and became one of the most powerful figures on Wall Street, is cashing in, The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz and Julie Creswell report.
